conclusion: The charged particle enters the magnetic field B1 perpendicularly at point O and undergoes circular motion due to the Lorentz force.
When the particle crosses the interface MN, it enters the second magnetic field B2, where B2 = B1/2, and undergoes circular motion with a different radius.
The trajectory of the particle forms a closed loop and the particle eventually returns to point O.
The radius of circular motion in a magnetic field is given by r = mv/qB.
In B1, the radius is r1 = mv/qB1.
In B2, the radius is r2 = mv/qB2.
Since B2 = B1/2, r2 = 2r1, meaning the radius in B2 is twice the radius in B1.
The time period of circular motion in a magnetic field is given by T = 2πr/v.
In B1, the time period is T1 = 2πr1/v.
In B2, the time period is T2 = 2πr2/v.
Since r2 = 2r1, T2 = 2T1, meaning the time period in B2 is twice the time period in B1.
The particle completes half a circular motion in B1 and half a circular motion in B2 before returning to point O.
In B1, the time for half a circular motion is t1 = T1/2 = πr1/v.
In B2, the time for half a circular motion is t2 = T2/2 = πr2/v.
Since r2 = 2r1, t2 = 2t1, meaning the time for half a circular motion in B2 is twice that in B1.
The total time to return to point O is t_total = t1 + t2 = 3πr1/v.
Substitute r1 = mv/qB1 into the expression for t_total.
